requirements.text: 1 from Camp + 4 from Demonstrate + 14 from Camp Leader
Complete the requirements for this badge.
Complete ALL of the following
Complete the requirements for this badge.
Complete ALL of the following
Complete the requirements for this badge.
Choose 1 of the following options

Option 1  Cooking for others: Plan a full, balanced menu for a group of Explorers or other people on a residential experience covering all meals for at least four days. Consider what facilities will be available.
Option 1  Cooking for others: Cook and serve your planned menu, demonstrating preparation and serving skills.
Option 1  Cooking for others: Demonstrate proper storage and cooking, including hygiene and how to prevent food poisoning.
Option 1  Cooking for others: Budget for your menu and assist with shopping for the ingredients.
Option 2  Baking: Maintain high standards of hygiene.
Option 2  Baking: Demonstrate how planning and preparation can make life easier when baking.

Option 2  Baking: Bake and cost from scratch (no packet mixes): three large cakes (20cm+) with different icings/decorations; a sweet or savoury tart (e.g., quiche or tarte tatin); 12 iced and filled cupcakes; 12 biscuits iced using the flooding method; 12 scones; a loaf of yeast bread; and 12 flatbreads.
Choose 1 of the following options

Option 1  Cooking for others: Plan a full, balanced menu for a group of Explorers or other people on a residential experience covering all meals for at least four days. Consider what facilities will be available.
Option 1  Cooking for others: Cook and serve your planned menu, demonstrating preparation and serving skills.
Option 1  Cooking for others: Demonstrate proper storage and cooking, including hygiene and how to prevent food poisoning.
Option 1  Cooking for others: Budget for your menu and assist with shopping for the ingredients.
Option 2  Baking: Maintain high standards of hygiene.
Option 2  Baking: Demonstrate how planning and preparation can make life easier when baking.

Option 2  Baking: Bake and cost from scratch (no packet mixes): three large cakes (20cm+) with different icings/decorations; a sweet or savoury tart (e.g., quiche or tarte tatin); 12 iced and filled cupcakes; 12 biscuits iced using the flooding method; 12 scones; a loaf of yeast bread; and 12 flatbreads.

Choose 1 of the following options
Complete the requirements for this badge.
Complete 3 of 7 requirements
Produce and give a presentation about Scouting.
Write a press release about a Scout event that has taken place.
Find out about local media outlets such as radio, TV, newspapers and online.
Prepare and present an audio or video package about a Scouting event or activity.
Prepare a creative display about your Troop or Group that can be exhibited in your local library, information centre or public place.
Interview a local public figure or someone in the local news, such as a church leader, politician or celebrity and present the interview to your Troop.
Produce some media which can be used within Scouting, such as a district newsletter story or a piece of website content.

Complete ALL of the following
Identify different types of snowsports.
Name three places you could safely take part in snowsport activities.
Take part in a warm-up activity to prepare you for a snowsport activity such as skiing or snowboarding (upper, middle and lower body).
Dress properly for your chosen activity and show you know the importance of helmets and how to put one on correctly.

Take part in a taster session that covers: naming equipment used; how to get in and out of your skis or snowboard; balancing; and moving around including moving in a straight line, controlling your speed and stopping.
Complete ALL of the following
Identify different types of snowsports.
Name three places you could safely take part in snowsport activities.
Take part in a warm-up activity to prepare you for a snowsport activity such as skiing or snowboarding (upper, middle and lower body).

Take part in a taster session that covers: naming equipment used; how to get in and out of your skis or snowboard; balancing; and moving around including moving in a straight line, controlling your speed and stopping.
